title: 109_s2106
content: The "Santa Ana River Water Supply Enhancement Act of 2005" is also known as the Prado Basin Natural Treatment System Project under the Reclamation Wastewater and Groundwater Study and Facilities Act. The Secretary, in cooperation with the Orange County Water District, will participate in planning, designing, and constructing natural treatment systems and wetlands for the Santa Ana River flows into the Prado Basin. The Federal share of the project cost will not exceed 25%, and funds provided by the Secretary cannot be used for project operation and maintenance. $20,000,000 is authorized for this section, with a sunset clause 10 years after enactment. (b) Conforming Amendment.--The table of sections in Public Law 102-575 is amended by inserting a new section after section 1634. SEC. 1637. REGIONAL BRINE LINES. The Reclamation Wastewater and Groundwater Study and Facilities Act is amended to include the Regional Brine Lines project. The Secretary may assist in constructing regional brine lines in Southern California to export salinity from the Colorado River to the Pacific Ocean. The Federal share of the project cost shall not exceed 25 percent. The Secretary may enter agreements and regulations as needed. The Secretary may provide funds for projects but not for operation or maintenance. The section expires 10 years after enactment. SEC. 1638. LOWER CHINO DAIRY AREA DESALINATION DEMONSTRATION AND RECLAMATION PROJECT. This section further amends the Reclamation Wastewater and Groundwater Study and Facilities Act by adding a new project for desalination and reclamation in the Lower Chino Dairy Area. The Secretary, in collaboration with various agencies, will participate in the Lower Chino Dairy Area desalination project. The Federal share of the project cost is limited to 25% or $50,000,000. Funds provided by the Secretary cannot be used for project operation or maintenance. Appropriations are authorized as needed. This section will expire at a certain point. The section will expire 10 years after enactment, with a conforming amendment to the table of sections in Public Law 102-575. Lower Chino dairy area desalination demonstration and reclamation project. Ceiling increase on federal share of water reclamation project. The Federal share of costs for the project authorized by section 1624 is capped at specific amounts for each fiscal year from 2007 to 2015, ranging from $22,000,000 to $47,158,953. The Federal share of costs for the project authorized by section 1624 is capped at $47,158,953 for fiscal year 2015 and $51,874,849 for fiscal year 2016. The Center for Technological Advancement of Membrane Technology and Education is established. The Secretary of the Interior establishes a center at the Orange County Water District in California for developing membrane technologies and providing educational support for public understanding of membrane produced water supplies. The center will be managed through contracts with the water district, and a plan will be jointly prepared with the district to identify goals and objectives. The Secretary of the Interior establishes a center at the Orange County Water District in California for developing membrane technologies and providing educational support. $2,000,000 is authorized annually for fiscal years 2006 through 2011. The Secretary will provide annual reports to Congress on the center's status and accomplishments. This section will expire 10 years after enactment.
